description: The buttonMode property has been removed

Polyfills have been removed.
This will most likely be breaking for IE users, where some of the newer functionality is not implemented from default.
If you need compatibility for a browser not supporting one or more of the removed functionality, you will now have to add polyfills yourself. See [polyfill.io](https://www.npmjs.com/package/polyfill-library)
You can see which browsers support a specific function here: https://caniuse.com/.
Extensions now Self-Install, users do not need to call extensions.add anymore
Remove the @pixi/loaders packages and related plugins

Set PREFER_ENV default to WEBGL2 for all devices. 
WEBGL2 has a few more features than WEBGL1 but unfortunately not all older mobile devices support this standard. 
If you need to support a mobile device without support for WEBGL2 you can fallback to using WEBGL1 by changing the value of the PREFER_ENV property like:
   `pixi.settings.PREFER_ENV = 1;`
To see a list of which mobile devices support which of the two standards see: https://gist.github.com/TimvanScherpenzeel/f8efeeb1dbed38a5c5dc0c29768a0413
Auto-transform to identity when using generateTexture

Pixi No longer transpiled to ES5. Pixi now targets ES2017 for browsers and ES2020 for module distribution. 
This change can break some features in older browsers not supporting the new features of ES2016+.
For instance a browser like IE pre. version 11 would have problems using es6 packages. 
If you need to target a browser not supporting es6, you can use something like [barbel](https://babeljs.io/) which is capable or porting the package to ES5.
To see the different browser versions not supporting es6 see: https://caniuse.com/?search=es6. 
To see which node-/browser versions supporting the different ES2016+ features see: https://kangax.github.io/compat-table/es2016plus/.
`nextRoundedRectBehavior = true` is now the default behavior
`nextLineHeightBehavior = true` is now the default behavior
Using hitTest with events has changed
CanvasExtract.base64(), CanvasExtract.image(), Extract.base64(), Extract.image() are now async methods
